title: A pickup’s persistent plastic pan problems
author: John Paul
bullets: A Ford F-150 owner faces repeated oil pan leaks, requiring three replacements of the plastic component since 2018.
Ford offers a metal oil pan alternative for $200, but labor costs are double those for a plastic pan replacement.
Ford will cover only plastic pan replacements under warranty, leaving the owner to consider repair options.

title: Patriots get bad news with injuries ahead of Bucs matchup
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots' Kayshon Boutte, Rhamondre Stevenson, and Garrett Bradbury missed Wednesday's practice due to injuries.
Rookies TreVeyon Henderson and Terrell Jennings combined for 90 rushing yards in the previous game.
Tampa Bay Bucs' Chris Godwin and Bucky Irving also missed practice, while Mike Evans remains absent.

title: Boston youth baseball coach pleads not guilty to drug trafficking charge
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Youth baseball coach Bryan Mejia, 31, charged with felony fentanyl trafficking at Boston Athletic Academy.
Mejia allegedly sold fentanyl to an undercover officer, linked to a trafficking operation, exceeding 10 grams.
Released on personal recognizance, Mejia pled not guilty; next court appearance set for December 1.

title: Education technology company to close Boston headquarters, embrace fully remote workplace
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Cengage Group announced plans to close its Boston, Detroit, and Cincinnati offices, shifting to a fully remote workforce.
The company, a major edtech firm, has nearly 4,000 employees serving around 90 million students globally.
Cengage's transition includes closing offices at 3 Center Plaza and 200 Pier 4 Blvd, with only one domestic location remaining.

title: What Patriots players did during their off day that impressed Mike Vrabel
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: 41 Patriots players worked out on their day off, impressing head coach Mike Vrabel.
Mike Vrabel highlighted the strong team commitment despite their 7-2 record midseason.
Stefon Diggs emphasized the team's ongoing dedication and drive to establish their identity.

title: Officials identify two killed in apparent murder-suicide in Beverly
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Becky Lynn Center, 58, and John Patrick Nesbitt, 56, were identified as victims of an apparent murder-suicide in Beverly.
The incident occurred at a home on Colonial Drive, where both individuals were found dead with gunshot wounds.
Beverly police and Massachusetts State Police are jointly investigating the case alongside the Chief Medical Examiner's Office.

title: South Boston man linked to Bulger sentenced to 15 years for involvement in 1984, 1993 cold case killings
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Michael Lewis of South Boston was sentenced to 15 years for two manslaughter convictions linked to 1984 and 1993 murders.
Lewis was initially charged with first-degree murder for 1984 killing of Brian Watson and 1993 killing of William Villani.
The sentence was a plea deal due to legal vulnerabilities; Lewis confessed to the killings in a covert recording in 2020.

title: Olney: Red Sox ‘well-positioned’ to try and trade for Tigers ace Tarik Skubal
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Red Sox are considering a trade for Tigers' Tarik Skubal, a key AL pitcher and 2024 Cy Young winner.
Skubal's trade comes as Detroit might move him before his free agency after 2026, possibly leading to a bidding war.
Boston can use MLB regulars or young talent as trade assets and afford a long-term contract for Skubal.

title: Judge temporarily halts patron saint statues in Quincy, but PETA wants to help
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Judge halted installation of two patron saint statues in Quincy due to religious concerns and lack of transparency.
PETA offered financial support for the statues if a St. Francis of Assisi statue is added, promoting kindness to animals.
ACLU lawsuit led to injunction; city hired Becket Fund to appeal, with plans to relocate statues discussed.

title: Bill Belichick commends Drake Maye for an ‘outstanding’ start with Patriots
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Bill Belichick praised Patriots quarterback Drake Maye for his strong start in the NFL season.
Drake Maye boasts third-best MVP odds, throwing for 2,285 yards and 17 touchdowns this season.
Patriots have a 7-2 record, aided by Maye's performance as one of the league's top young quarterbacks.
